attributes.action: Pass a law restricting the promotion and display of alcoholic beverages in shops
attributes.background: Shops must be more responsible by not displaying alcoholic beverages at the front of the shop where people are forced to pass by it. They should limit the use of promotional marketing so as not to encourage people to purchase alcohol, particularly vulnerable & disadvantaged people in society.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands die from alcohol-related diseases every year. The cost and burden on the NHS is vast. It is the second biggest preventable killer behind smoking. The negative impact of alcohol is worse than smoking because it takes away a persons dignity, self esteem and ruins the lives of family and loved ones. Banning advertising of cigarettes has reduced smoking-related illness. Alcohol should be no different. For example, Tesco should not be having a 'Drinks Festival' a campaign encouraging people to drink.

attributes.action: Increase NHS budgets to help acid attack victims
attributes.background: Acid Attack victims face not only physical pain but also mental trauma that should be urgently helped. This can happen if the NHS budget increases so that there are more facilities available for this kind of treatment as the budget cuts to the NHS could hinder these emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: Victims of this heinous crime have to wait due to the lack of facilities to help them because of the NHS budget cut that makes it harder to treat them. Victims have to wait for longer periods of time that could take up to months or even years to book for their own appointments which should not be happening.

attributes.action: Scrap Vehicle Excise Duty and raise excise duty on fuel.
attributes.background: Instead of wasting valuable police resources chasing untaxed drivers, when they should be tackling more serious crime, scrap VED and add 10 pence to the price of a litre of fuel. That way, the more you drive the more you pay.
attributes.additional_details: We all know that manufacturer's fuel consumption figures are very unreliable. This way people will pay the fair amount due in tax based on their consumption and their mileage. It doesn't penalise the drivers who have to have a car because bus services in their rural area are non- existent and without a car they wouldn't be able to get to hospitals for appointments or to the shop for essentials.

attributes.action: Introduce a goverment helpline for mental health
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people will expirence a mental health issue each year. Why don’t we have a goverment helpline, like 999, for people expirencing a problem or crisis? We need to do more to help people.

attributes.action: Exempt animals purchased from a rescue centre from VAT on vets bills
attributes.background: To discourage unnecessary breeding of animals which are over represented in rescue centres, I am asking that any animal purchased from a rescue centre should be exempt from the 20% VAT on vets’s bills and a corresponding reduction in their insurance premium.
attributes.additional_details:
This would encourage people to buy from rescue centres and discourage the breeding purely for money of those breeds which are over represented in rescue centres.
Owners would register proof of purchase from a recognised rescue centre with their vet and have their record marked as exempt from VAT.

attributes.action: Ban food waste food away require companies to give it to people who need it
attributes.background: Many companies around the UK throw away waste food at the end of the day away. This needs to stop and the food should be given to people who need it the most, for example homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 France banned food waste and made it compulsory for supermarkets to donate unsold food to charities. The UK government should enact a similar law.

attributes.action: Lower the percentage for child maintenance deductions from earnings
attributes.background: The current cms payment scheme for non resident parents has a massive impact on non resident working people that are paying rent and bills for their current living situation. A drop in pay or overtime no less than 25 % will leave you with nothing to pay rent and bills.
attributes.additional_details: Non resident fathers will be left in financial difficulty with the cms payment scheme and would be forced to leave work this is not good for the kids that need money.

attributes.action: Amend Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 and Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988
attributes.background: I am a scooter rider who has ridden to work, from Kew to Central London, each day for many many years...with no fines! I have recently received 4 speeding tickets in one week for marginally exceeding the speed limit on the A40.
attributes.additional_details: I strongly believe the punishments in such cases (SP 30) do not fit the crime. My suggestion is that the law is changed so that penalty points are allocated depending on the amount of the excess speed reached...for instance 1 penalty point for 5 mile per hour excess..2 penalty points for 10 miles per hour and so on.

attributes.action: Allow gritting lorries to use blue lights during snow emergencies.
attributes.background: New technology is now available for dual colour LEDs that can have 2 colours, I propose that gritting lorries/ snow ploughs be fitted with Amber / blue lights so during periods on snowfall, gritting lorries can switch to blue lights to make it mandatory to move out the way and allow them to pass.
attributes.additional_details:
I have previously been stuck behind a plough in heavy snow sitting in traffic because because would not move out the way. The driver got out and told around 10 cars to move over, he then gave up as others were just sitting there, in the end we was all stuck for over 4 hours including the gritting lorry.
The new LEDS could have Amber on normal conditions with the ability to switch to blue when required as vehicles would have to allow them to pass to clear the road ahead

attributes.action: School needs to finish earlier and start later
attributes.background: I spend most of my day in school. I would love it if school would start later and finish earlier, as when I wake up for school I’m so tired. I don’t think this is fair. We have one life, let’s live it.

attributes.action: make school weeks become four days instead of five
attributes.background: I think we should have four days at school because five days is way too much because after 4 days you just get tiered of being at school and begin to get slack on you’re work so if we had four days I think everyone would be more enthusiastic about school.
attributes.additional_details: I have seen that on every Friday of the week people are slacking because they are so tiered from the rest of the week this is why we should have a four day school week

attributes.action: Make it a legal UK requirement that councils provide public toilets.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK, public toilets are closing. These actions are unfair on all sections of our society. It is a natural requirement to use toilets. It is illegal to defecate or urinate in the street so it should be a legal requirement to provide the facilities required to avoide breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details:
When the body needs to meet such needs, no amount of will power will over ride this no mater what the legal penalty is so what civilised country should put its citizens in such a position.

Councils should legally provide such services in all urban areas but should also not issue licences to any businesses selling refreshments if there are not toilet facilities available to its customers within say 100 meters of the business.

attributes.action: All primary schools to have a 20mph zone set within 1/4 mile
attributes.background: Local authorities should be required by law to set a 20 mph zone near primary schools. It is safer to cross a road with children when the speed limit is 20mph.

attributes.action: Add hot spices to the list of recognised allergens
attributes.background: Many people and businesses don't realise the damage done when someone with spice intolerance eats food that may only contain a mild/medium amount of heat. Crohns, IBD and Colitis sufferers may get  digestive upsets, severe pain, intestinal bleeding and need specialist treatment to calm the effects.
attributes.additional_details: Spice is all too often hidden especially in restaurants where inappropriate levels of spice heat can ruin a whole meal. I have had multiple occasions where a member of staff will assure us that there is no spice in a dish and when it arrives it is necessary to send the food back. Supermarket packaging the ingredients listed as 'spices' (on many foods it cannot be avoided) can hide items which will cause serious effects.

attributes.action: Counselling and support should be provided for those who commit crimes early on.
attributes.background: This is for our citizenship GCSE campaign and we strongly believe that if changes were made, then crimes within the youth would be significantly reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
In the year 2017,  4,315,500 crimes were recorded. 
74,784 were the arrests of young children and the youth. 
On average a custodial sentenced youth sentence length would be around 16 months long.
13,500 youth cautions were given to young people throughout the UK.
We believe that if we can read signs and tackle them with suitable guidance then we will be able to reduce these numbers and hopefully provide a better future for the next generation.
With proper support, counselling and guidance from the government real changes can be made. Help create sustainable futures for OUR youth.

attributes.action: Transition the United Kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics
attributes.background: Abolish the monarchy and reform the United kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics

attributes.action: Make landlords of privately owned student property liable for council tax
attributes.background: In the last 10 years, as the uni near my home has grown, landlords have bought and extended many properties in the area and let them to students, who all use the services provided by the council.   No one is paying for their  use of local council services eg rubbish collection.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the properties, 3 bed family homes with average sized families, have been extended so there are 8-10 students in some. They require extra refuse bins, extra demand on health services and extra policing. Landlords are earning a minimum of £120 per room per week so can afford and should be paying for the extra services the student population uses. The extra revenue would help to pay for local health and social care costs.

attributes.action: Amend Universal Credit regulations so it can cover 53 week periods
attributes.background: Universal Credit (UC) is paid monthly to Landlords. If rent is paid weekly, the monthly rate is worked out by multiplying the weekly rent by 52, then dividing by 12.
attributes.additional_details:
However, every 5-7 years some landlords charge for 53 weeks! So UC Claimants lose out 1 whole week of rent! This is unfair to Claimants and Landlords!
 
I quote from UC website: "Universal Credit will always be calculated based on a 52 week year, unless rent is charged over fewer than 52 weeks".
 
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/universal-credit-and-rented-housing--2/universal-credit-and-rented-housing-guide-for-landlords
 
This issue has been raised a few times directly with Universal Credit, but they are adamant they will only pay for 52 weeks! This needs to be raised for a discussion by the Parliament. Help me reach 100,000 signs!

attributes.action: Hard Remain: Align with other EU countries and adopt Schengen and the euro.
attributes.background: Many people are unhappy with the various varieties of brexit that are on the table. But many are also unhappy with the current membership of the EU. Another option would be for a "hard remain". The UK should become part of the Schengen area, adopt the euro currency, and adopt EU driving standards.

attributes.action: Amend Royal Charter to stop BBC paying more than twice Prime Minister’s salary
attributes.background: The BBC is a public service and should not pay excessive salaries or other payments to individuals. Paying anyone over £1.5m a year to watch and comment on sport or present a 3 hour radio show is too much. Alternative talent could be found at lower salary levels.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly funded bodies have shown disregard for financial discipline and the BBC may be the worst. If commercial entities want to pay their staff excessive salaries and perks let their shareholders approve it or otherwise. The taxpayers are the BBC shareholders and I say enough is enough. who work primarily for the BBC should also pay tax and NI like everyone else at source. The talent will evolve to fill any gaps.

attributes.action: 65% majority referendum to approve the offer to leave EU or else stay in the EU
attributes.background:
Lisbon Treaty Art 50 in effect needs 65% of remaining population to approve a state leaving. Therefore 65% of population leaving should approve
UK Companies Act 2006: 75% vote to change rules that govern its conduct with members. We are considering the relationship between the UK and its citizens
attributes.additional_details:
2016 Referendum result: Leave 17,410,742 – 51.89%; Remain 16,141,241- 48.11% – just 3.78% in favour.  This has been, and continues to be, a most divisive and disproportionate margin for the well being of the UK and its citizens

When the 2016 referendum was taken the campaign was generalised slogans and proclamations and could not clearly set out specific consequences and realities: which were at the time impossible to know. Now we know them

To end division and animosity we need clear majority

attributes.action: Recognise in DWP assessments that depression and anxiety are debilitating
attributes.background: I suffer severe depression and anxiety, yet the DWP deem me to be fit for work. I have been refused every benefit I've applied for based on a medical assessment in 2015. I'm certain there are thousands of others in similar positions.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should ensure medical assessments recognise the impact of these illness when assessing peoples’ fitness to work.

attributes.action: Minimum speed limit for motorways.
attributes.background: Make the minimum speed limit for cars on motorways to match the maximum speed for trucks. Cars travelling slower than trucks cause dangerous situations where the truck has to overtake or be forced to slow down. This is especially dangerous on two lane sections and in bad weather.

attributes.action: Increase funding for mental health services and accommodation for veterans
attributes.background: Thousands of ex-military personnel are currently either homeless or suffering with mental health issues. It is diabolical that people who have served this country are being left behind in such a manner; it is high time for the government to start actively tackling this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/least-13000-hero-soldiers-left-11847000

https://www.bbc.com/news/health-45761546

attributes.action: Introduce Knife crime awareness/first aid workshops into schools.
attributes.background: As I write this petition 119 people have died this year of violent crimes, a huge percentage of the deaths have been to knife crime. Children should be educated on the dangers of knif crime, the consequences of carrying a knife, more importantly what to do in a situation If confronted by a knife.
attributes.additional_details:
London knife crime unfortunately is spiralling out of control and sadly most effected are young people. In a recent report it was mentioned how Children may be more vulnerable to becoming a stabbing victim on their way home from school.

Schools, should tackle these issues, have awareness classes, what to say? What to do? When confronted by someone with a knife. First aid courses, knowing vital organs, consequences of carrying a knife and much more.

attributes.action: Say NO to meat tax
attributes.background: Do not consider imposing additional taxes on meat products. Introducing a product specific tax will only serve to penalise the poor. Instead of reducing consumer choices, it would be more beneficial to educate the public about the impact on their health and environment.
attributes.additional_details:
There are examples in the past which show that these sorts of taxes are just another way of extracting more money from the public. Rarely do they have the full desired effect on consumption.
Furthermore, meat is not the leading cause of heart disease or global warming, thus it would make more sense to target those sectors.

attributes.action: Post-Study Work Visa for International Students after completion of Course.
attributes.background: IISAU on behalf of all International students studying in the UK appeals to reintroduce post-study work visa for international students after completion of the degree program.
attributes.additional_details: Indian International students and Alumni Union is raising the voice for all International students in UK. The Migration Advisory Committee recommended an automatic period of leave to remain after studies complete. A post-study work visa would make the UK a more attractive destination for international students and graduates, enabling it to compete with other popular destinations such as the United States, Australia, and Canada who have more welcoming student visa policies.

attributes.action: Require all Staffordshire bull terriers to be muzzled & leashed when in public.
attributes.background: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers. Dog chipping has not resulted in any reduction in dangerous dog attacks as claimed by politicians prior to the introduction of that legislation.

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Sensory Therapy to be offered in all areas
attributes.background:
My son has been denied sensory therapy recently, due to it not being commissioned in our area. This is due to there not being enough research to prove it's needed. 
My child, along with thousands of others need sensory therapy just as much as everyone needs access to a GP. 

This needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
I have written to the commisioners but had no joy, therefore I have taken this to the parliamentary ombudsman and I want to get as many signatures as possible to support my case and get our voices heard. 

Please sign. It takes 2 minutes but could help children for a lifetime.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: Limit domestic construction working hours
attributes.background: (The Ctrl of Pollution Act 1974 gives Env Health powers to control noise on construction & demolition sites.Permitted hrs of work when noise can be audible at a construction site boundary:Mon-Fri 8am-6pm Sat 8am-1pm) Domestically a neighbour can drill,bang on an adjoining wall all night,no law
attributes.additional_details:
I want to make the law apply to domestic construction noise pollution, it shouldn't just apply to construction sites.  This should apply to disturbing noise domestically.  I have had to endure (for a year so far) drilling & banging up until 11pm, all day Sunday at times.
When your sleep and peace is impacted it causes real stress.The police informed me that my neighbour can drill & bang on my adjoining wall all night, there is no law.  This surely just isn't healthy

attributes.action: Add electric pet containment systems (‘invisible fences’) to the e-collar ban.
attributes.background:
The recent e-collar ban is fundamentally flawed in still permitting use of electric containment systems which make similar use of the fear- and pain-based so-called ‘training aid’. 
‘Invisible fences’ inflict the same aversive stimulus on pets, scientifically proven to negatively affect welfare.

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to make full apology for comparing the EU and Soviet Union
attributes.background: The foreign secretary, Jeremy Hunt, has been rebuked by the European Commission for a speech at the Conservative party conference where he seemed to compare the European Union to the Soviet Union. Such remarks are damaging to Britain as a nation and particularly so coming from the Foreign Secretary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/oct/01/jeremy-hunt-draws-eu-ire-over-soviet-prison-comparison

attributes.action: Make all UK schools take GCSEs
attributes.background:
If you attend a state school now, you must take GCSEs 9-1. But if you are more privileged and go to a private school, you can take IGCSEs. 
IGCSEs can be easier than the new GCSEs 9-1 but are considered as equal levels of education. Should the rich be able to pay for easier qualifications?
attributes.additional_details:
Take English Literature for example, at IGCSE level, it's not totally closed book and you have the option to have 40% coursework. Not to mention the added 20% mark for speaking! Whereas at GCSE 9-1 level, exams are worth 100% of your grade and it's fully closed book - you must remember lots of quotes. 

Surely everyone has the right to take equal tests for equal qualifications?

http://everythingenglisheducation.co.uk/everything-english-education-gcse-reforms-igcse-versus-gcse-guess-who-wins/”

attributes.action: Close the legal loopholes in the High Hedges legislation
attributes.background: Part 8 of the Anti-Social Behaviour Act 2003 introduced legislation to combat the scourge of fast-growing evergreens like Leylandii which, when planted in a line as a hedge has blighted the lives of those living in neighbouring properties.
attributes.additional_details: A high hedge is defined as two or more evergreens, more that 2m tall planted in a line and where the branches meet so as to provide a barrier to light. Enforcement of high hedges legislation is the responsibility of councils.  However, the legislation does not cover individual trees and therefore people are merely cutting gaps in their hedges so that the former hedge becomes a line of individual trees which despite being large, cannot be dealt with by councils under the high hedges legislation.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for devolution in the North of England.
attributes.background: In 2004 the North East of England had a devolution referendum. Due to the small turnout the same referendum for the North West of England was never held. It is the opinion of many that the socio-economic divide between the North and the South of England has grown exponentially over the past decade.
attributes.additional_details: With growing cases of the North not having their issues and needs fairly addressed in the Southern biased Parliament, it is time that a referendum is held to offer those citizens North of the River Trent an opportunity to vote on devolution. This will provide a platform for issues relevant to the North of England to be considered without an underlying London-centricity.

attributes.action: Make Humanist weddings legally recognised in England and Wales
attributes.background: Humanist weddings have been legal in Scotland for over a decade, but in England and Wales they are not legally recognised. Couples wanting to have a Humanist ceremony have to pay to be legally married by a registrar separately to their Humanist ceremony, increasing costs and practicality issues.
attributes.additional_details:
https://humanism.org.uk/ceremonies/non-religious-weddings/faqs/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/sep/17/humanist-weddings-scotland-england-wales

https://humanism.org.uk/2018/05/24/parliamentarians-call-for-legal-humanist-marriages-in-england-and-wales/

attributes.action: Lower the legal age for buying alcohol and tobacco to 16 years old
attributes.background: Currently, students and under 18's nationwide are breaking the law in order to have a good time. Attempting to buy alcohol and tobacco under the age of 18 can lead to the criminalisation of young people.
attributes.additional_details: There are already approximately 136,500+ under 18's smoking on a daily basis. Being unable to buy alcohol and tobacco has not discouraged them and the added risk of under 18's joining the "wrong crowd" can lead them to further crime in their future life.

attributes.action: Reconsider licence requirement for small breeders to safeguard endangered breeds
attributes.background: Many dog breeds are endangered and can’t afford to lose breeders. Small breeders with <2 litters yearly in the home are concerned about being unable to meet the expense and requirements of the new licensing laws and may be forced out of business if they chance to make more than £1k in any one year.

attributes.action: Introduce unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives
attributes.background: My mother at the beginning of 2018 became seriously ill, and was admitted to hospital. Work was very good about it and gave me compassionate leave so I could go and see her
attributes.additional_details:
6/8/2018 I was told mum had only days left to live, but I was told I couldn’t have compassionate leave as I was not entitled to any and would have to phone in sick. 

I think it’s disrespectful not to be given compassionate leave for a dying relative, my mum passed that week. And basically lost two weeks wages. I think this is wrong for anyone to go through.

Unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives, would solve this issue for a lot of people.

attributes.action: More training for teachers in supporting and identifying childhood trauma
attributes.background: The number of children experiencing abuse is much higher than acknowledged and is a serious issue in society, leading to addiction, crime and costing the NHS a huge amount. We can target the root of the problem and give teachers, people who see children day in day out, the skills to support and help

attributes.action: Urge newly elected PM Imran Khan to stop persecution of Ahmadi Muslims
attributes.background: All over the world a small sect of Muslims known as the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community are persecuted and oppressed. Perhaps no other place do Ahmadis face worse persecution than in Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details:
In Pakistan oppressive laws mean Ahmadis often live in fear and are denied basic rights. Ahamadis cannot vote, their mosques are often targeted, for example, in 2010 where 86 Ahmadi worshippers were killed during Friday prayers and they can face up to 3 years in jail for calling themselves Muslims. 

Pakistan has just elected a new PM. PM Khan says that he want an just and equal society. There is now a golden opportunity for the UK Government to pressure Khan to address the persecution of Ahmadis.

attributes.action: Cap private housing rent based on the house value
attributes.background:
Private housing rent costs are through the roof!! No longer is it affordable to cover rent and have money spare for millions of people in the UK.
Landlords in the UK are making it impossible for low paid workers to get a better future for their family.
attributes.additional_details:
What's suggested is a Maximum cap based on the house value, most importantly low value housing costing under £250,000. A maximum rent of £500 per month is more than sufficient for the landlord to not only cover costs but still very profitable.
This WILL help millions of people in the UK better off and have a better living standard.

attributes.action: Laser hair removal free on the NHS for women with polycystic ovaries (PCOS)
attributes.background: PCOS causes a higher level of testosterone in females leading to increased bodily hair, which has been linked to mental health problems. Laser hair removal is free on the NHS for trans women because of their gender dysphoria and should be free for women with PCOS throughout England.

attributes.action: I think that children yr 7-9 should be able to have a 2.5 day weekend
attributes.background: In secondary school, children face much stress from h/w, changes in their life (physically and emotionally) and having the extra half day (finishing school at 12:00) would help so much. Children in yrs 7-9 need to be active and have fun and study at the same time- and I believe I have the solution.
attributes.additional_details: It is proven that children 13-19 (secondary school children) are the age group who take their lives the most and it is also proven that most of the time this is because of bullying or STRESS. With my petition I believe that the extra half day would allow children to have fun and work to high enough standerds. This is mostly aimed at 11-14/15 yr olds. The extra half a day also allows children to be active and another major rising problem is obesity which my solution can also conquer. This is also good for the teachers, who will have more time to work for better results Thank you.

attributes.action: Provide funding for school children to access leisure centres or gyms
attributes.background: Leisure centre memberships are expensive and many families cannot afford them. This is why I think pupils from primary to end of secondary schools should be provided with them. First to motivate more children to get into sports and to get fitter and to resolve Britain’s immense problem with obesity.
attributes.additional_details:
Did you know that in England the prevalence of overweight and obesity is above 70% among all age groups from 45 upwards.
 
For more information go visit https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN03336/SN03336.pdf

attributes.action: Make law for dogs to be insured for damage injury to humans and other species
attributes.background: In order to make people more responsible for dog ownership make it law for all dogs to be covered  against injury death damage to humans to other species and property

attributes.action: Change the Help to Buy rule of owning a property or share of one abroad.
attributes.background: My wife & I are British Citizens. Originally from abroad, we have family who still there. We are trying to buy a house through one the Government's Help-To-Buy Schemes but don't qualify because unfortunately my mother died and left me a share of her property in her will.
attributes.additional_details: The law of the country says I cannot give my share away to any of the heirs and trying to sell it to a third party individual is near impossible given the risks and future shared ownership with private individuals of the property. This continues to disqualify my family & I from the Help-To-Buy Schemes.

attributes.action: Stop NI contributions affected by the 1995 and 2011 Pension Acts
attributes.background: 1995 and 2011 Pension Acts means thousands will have worked for over 50 years by the time they reach SPa. This petition ensures some financial compensation for this group of women by ceasing NI contribution for those women who would have made sufficient contribution before they reach SPa.
attributes.additional_details: I cannot provide accurate evidence of the number of women affected by this proposal. However, in my own situation and hearsay evidence from women in my age group this change would mean that the last year or few years before reaching SPa, some women would benefit financially albeit they may pay additional tax on the additional money not deducted by  NI contributions.
